clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Sequential Stent Addition vs. Incremental Dilation & Stent Exchange for Management of Anastomotic Biliary Strictures After Liver Transplantation
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Sequential Stent Addition vs. Incremental Dilation & Stent Exchange for Management of Anastomotic Biliary Strictures After Liver Transplantation

brief_summary.textblock: Prospective, randomized comparison of the incremental dilation and stent exchange vs. sequential stent addition approaches for management of anastomotic biliary strictures will facilitate optimal management of patients who develop anastomotic biliary strictures after liver transplantation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately following final ERCP with stent removal
primary_outcome.description: Fluoroscopic (on ERCP image) resolution of stricture at the time of final study ERCP when all stents are removed

secondary_outcome.description: Fluoroscopy Time per fluoroscopy machine output
Pancreatitis, bleeding, infection, perforation to be assessed one day and one week post-procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: Sustained resolution of anastomotic stricture for 6 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months after final study ERCP with stent removal
secondary_outcome.description: No evidence of recurrent stricture based on clinical status and laboratory studies

secondary_outcome.measure: Sustained resolution of anastomotic stricture for 12 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months after final study ERCP with stent removal
secondary_outcome.description: No evidence of recurrent stricture based on clinical status and laboratory studies

arm_group.description: ERCP with sphincterotomy and stent placement is initially performed, then additional stents are placed across the stricture during sequential ERCPs, without stent removal/exchange or stricture dilation.

ERCP with sphincterotomy and stent placement is initially performed, with subsequent ERCPs involving removal of previously placed stents, stricture dilation and balloon sweeps to extract stone debris/sludge.

intervention.intervention_name: Protocol for increasing number of stents across the anastomosis
intervention.description: Sequential placement of straight plastic biliary stents across the duct-to-duct anastomosis without dilation or stent exchange. Multiple ERCPs will be performed with addition of a single stent at each ERCP until the final ERCP when all stents will be removed.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age 18 and older
2. Clinical concern for anastomotic biliary stricture following liver transplantation (as determined by the referring transplant hepatologist)
3. Willing and able to comply with the study procedures and provide written informed consent to participate in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Age <18
2. Potentially vulnerable subjects including, homeless people, pregnant females, employees and students.
3. Complex post-surgical anatomy e.g. Choledochojejunostomy, Billroth type II anatomy, Roux-en-Y-gastrojejunostomy
4. Participation in another investigational study that may directly or indirectly affect the results of this study within 30 days prior to the initial visit
5. Other biliary process which accounts for patient's abnormal liver function studies/imaging (i.e. significant non-anastomotic biliary stricture).
